intro: Cyathocalyx annamensis, commonly known as the Annam cyathocarp, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive fruit structure known as a cyathocarp. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
